publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1778 Rob Gibson: Highland Food and Drink Festival—That the Parliament wishes every success to the 4th Highland Food and Drink Festival which takes place from 30 September to 3 October 2004; welcomes the increasing public interest in high quality local produce that forms the basis of the festival’s ingredients; notes the growing demand for clear labelling of all food and drink products, and congratulates the festival organisers for focusing attention on the enjoyment of quality food and drink in the Highlands. Supported by: Fergus Ewing*, Patrick Harvie*, Richard Lochhead*, Mr Adam Ingram*, Mr Stewart Maxwell*, Brian Adam*, Eleanor Scott*, Linda Fabiani*, Shiona Baird*, Murray Tosh*, Roseanna Cunningham*, Stewart Stevenson*, John Scott*
S2M-1778 Highland Food and Drink Festival (lodged on 28 September 2004) Bruce Crawford*, Alex Neil*, Jim Mather*, Robin Harper*, Michael Matheson*, Maureen Macmillan*, Mary Scanlon*
S2M-1778 Highland Food and Drink Festival (lodged on 28 September 2004) Ms Sandra White*

S2M-1778 Rob Gibson: Highland Food and Drink Festival—That the Parliament wishes every success to the 4th Highland Food and Drink Festival which takes place from 30 September to 3 October 2004; welcomes the increasing public interest in high quality local produce that forms the basis of the festival’s ingredients; notes the growing demand for clear labelling of all food and drink products, and congratulates the festival organisers for focusing attention on the enjoyment of quality food and drink in the Highlands. *The member has provided the following Gaelic translation: Fèis Bidh agus Dibhe na Gaidhealtachd— Gu bheil a’ Phàrlamaid airson ‘s gun soirbhich gu mòr an 4mh Fèis Bidh agus Dibhe na Gaidhealtachd, a bhios a’ gabhail àite eadar 30 Sultain agus 3 Dàmhair 2004; gu bheil i a’ cur fàilte air an ùidh nas motha a th’ aig a’ phoball ann an sàr thoradh ionadail air a bheil am fèis stèidhichte; gu bheil i a’ toirt fa-near air na h-iarrtasan nas motha airson labels nas soilleire air a h-uile seòrsa bidh is deoch; agus gu bheil i a’ cur meal-a-naidheachd air luchd-eagrachaidh na fèise ann a bhith a’ tarraing aire air cho blasta ‘s a tha biadh agus deoch na Gaidhealtachd.* Supported by: Fergus Ewing, Patrick Harvie, Richard Lochhead, Mr Adam Ingram, Mr Stewart Maxwell, Brian Adam, Eleanor Scott, Linda Fabiani, Shiona Baird, Murray Tosh, Roseanna Cunningham, Stewart Stevenson, John Scott, Bruce Crawford, Alex Neil, Jim Mather, Robin Harper, Michael Matheson, Maureen Macmillan, Mary Scanlon, Ms Sandra White, Chris Ballance*
S2M-1778 Highland Food and Drink Festival (lodged on 28 September 2004) Nora Radcliffe*, Donald Gorrie*
S2M-1778 Highland Food and Drink Festival (lodged on 28 September 2004) Trish Godman*
S2M-1778 Highland Food and Drink Festival (lodged on 28 September 2004) Dr Jean Turner*
